name: Tristan T.
short_description: Tristan T. is affiliated with d-Matrix and Eindhoven University of Technology. He has volunteering experience as a Board Treasurer at E.S.D.A. Chronos and is currently a member of Nova. He has published research on the influence of ASFBot on human comments in issue trackers.
long_description:
Tristan T. is a professional associated with d-Matrix and has an educational background from Eindhoven University of Technology. His academic achievements include receiving the ALSP Scholarship from the Amandus H. Lundqvist Scholarship Program in September 2021, which is a merit-based scholarship including tuition waiver and monthly stipend.

In terms of volunteering experience, Tristan served as a Board Treasurer at E.S.D.A. Chronos from May 2019 to May 2020, and has been a member of Nova since November 2022. 

Tristan has contributed to academic research, publishing a paper titled "Between JIRA and GitHub: ASFBot and its Influence on Human Comments in Issue Trackers" with IEEE in June 2022. 

He maintains an active GitHub profile since December 2015, suggesting involvement in software development or programming. Tristan is fluent in Dutch (native proficiency) and English (full professional proficiency).

With 688 followers and over 500 connections on LinkedIn, Tristan appears to have built a substantial professional network in his field.
